Thanks a lot for this clarification!

So, assuming I have an arc file that =
I created using the crawler, how
then do  I convert it to a warc.gz file?

=

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Ko, Lauren" <lauren.ko@...>
wrote=
:
>
> I think the issue you are having is arising because compressed warcs
=
are actually created by concatenating compressed warc records. When you
dow=
nload the warc from archive.org and test it against your code, each
record =
is compressed to specification so it works. When you uncompress
it then man=
ually recompress the entire file yourself, each record is no
longer individ=
ually compressed so it is failing.
>
> Lauren Ko
> Digital Projects Unit
> =
University of North Texas Libraries
> _____________________________________=
___
> From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
[archive-crawler@...=
m] On Behalf Of sykushel [shaulk@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, July 28, 2009 1:58 A=
M
> To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [archive-crawler] Readin=
g warc and warc.gz files
>
> I am using the following code to read both war=
c and warc.gz files.
>
>                                warcReader =3D WARC=
ReaderFactory.get(new
File(warcPath));
>
>             Iterator<ArchiveReco=
rd> it =3D warcReader.iterator();
>             int counter=3D0;
>         =
    while (it.hasNext()) {
>
>                 ArchiveRecord record =3D it.=
next();
>                 counter++;
>             }
>             System.o=
ut.println("Num of records in file is: "+counter);
>
> I tested this with t=
he file downloaded from
http://www.archive.org/details/ExampleArcAndWarcFil=
es and it worked
fine, I the decompressed the file and again it worked OK, =
but if I
compress the decompressed file, it will not manage to read more th=
en 1
record.
> The issue I have with warc file that I created myself.
> I h=
ave arc files that I created using the crawler, and then converted
them to =
warc using the Arc2Warc().transform call.
> The code works fine for the reg=
ular warc files, but if I compress them
to warc.gz, it will never pass the =
first record.
>
> Any idea?
>
